sentences.english: Adam is your average working-class guy living in small-town America.
sentences.chinese: 亞當是普通工薪階層的人生活在美國的一個小鎮。

sentences.english: But in today's America, you are just another working stiff.
sentences.chinese: 然而在今天的美國，你不過是普通的工薪階層罷了。

sentences.english: Most come from poor and working-class families.
sentences.chinese: 其中大部分人出生於窮人和工薪階層家庭。

sentences.english: For average bread earners, it is beyond their means to afford houses and cars.
sentences.chinese: 對一般工薪階層，購房買車是他們力所不及的。

sentences.english: A: Under such harsh economic downturns, working class can hardly make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 經濟下滑這麼厲害，工薪階層快要揭不開鍋了。

sentences.english: Using mortgage purchases at the highest price, it is also our wage- earners .
sentences.chinese: 用按揭在最高價買房的，也恰恰正是我們的工薪階層。

sentences.english: I also agree thatthe censorious attitudes toward working class opinion in the US was the biggestreason Trump became president.
sentences.chinese: 對美國工薪階層的態度是特朗普當上總統的最大原因。

sentences.english: Under such harsh economic downturns, working class can hardly make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 經濟下滑這麼厲害，工薪階層快要揭不開鍋了。

sentences.english: Mutual aid was particularly popular among the poor and the working class.
sentences.chinese: 互助會的模式在貧困及工薪階層中尤爲普及。

sentences.english: President Obama wants to get some of it from the top 2% of wage-earners.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬總統希望得到來自工薪階層的2%。

sentences.english: Working-class consumers are responding to inflation by pursuing higher wages.
sentences.chinese: 工薪階層消費者則通過尋求漲工資來應對通脹。

sentences.english: Both the husband and wife are wage-earners.

definition: to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
lit. a cup of water on a burning cart of firewood (idiom); fig. an utterly inadequate measure
responsible for its profit and losses (of organization)/financially autonomous/personal financial responsibility
